intro: Thlaspi goesingense, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to alpine regions of Europe and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Thlaspi goesingense is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in mountain ecosystems.
